title: Arenko claims first in qualifying non-BMU battery for Dynamic Containment's monitoring requirement
lead: ​Arenko has become the first provider to qualify a non-Balancing Mechanism Unit (BMU) while complying with Dynamic Containment's requirement for real time monitoring.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: National Grid Renewables announces Blake Nixon will take on top role
lead: National Grid Renewables' Daniel Westerman is to step down in April as he takes a new job in Australia.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Have batteries solved the ‘missing money’ problem?
lead: Flexitricity’s Dr Alastair Martin takes a look at how batteries and the Capacity Market have grown over the past decade to meet the so-called “missing money” problem.
author: Dr Alastair Martin

title: EDF made over £7.5m in one day in January as it reacted to tight margins
lead: ​In January, EDF was paid more in three days than it did in Q3 2020, as low winds and cold temperatures pushing National Grid ESO’s ability to balance the system.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Customers adapt EV charging when there are smart incentives finds Shift trial
lead: ​Customers do shift their charging to off-peak times when there are smart charging incentives, the Shift trial has found.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ultra-rapid EV chargers surging in popularity - ZapMap
lead: ​A rise in the usage of ultra-rapid chargers has been recorded by Zap-Map in a new survey of electric vehicle (EV) drivers.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Batteries could save £195m annually by providing Reserve finds National Grid ESO trial
lead: ​Using batteries for reserve could save £195 million a year, according to the results of an Arenko led National Grid ESO trial.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UKPN and WWU launch hybrid ‘cross vector’ low carbon heating trial
lead: ​DNO UK Power Networks (UKPN) has launched a hybrid low carbon heating system trial together with gas network Wales & West Utilities (WWU).
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BEIS bumps up T-1 Capacity Market auction target to 2.4GW
lead: ​The Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) has increased the target for the next T-1 Capacity Market auction from 0.4GW to 2.4GW following the latest guidance.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Octopus Energy launches ‘world first’ entech research organisation
lead: ​Octopus Energy has launched an entech-led research organisation dubbed the Octopus Centre for Net Zero (OCNZ) to help create a tech-enabled green energy system.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ​Current± Chats: WPD and CrowdCharge on measuring the impact of V2G on networks
lead:
Current± caught up with Mike Potter (MP), CEO of CrowdCharge, and Ricky Duke (RD), innovation and low carbon network engineer at WPD, to talk about what they hope to discover from the project.
​
author: Alice Grundy

title: Wales announces ‘decisive shift’ towards green energy as it commits to net zero by 2050
lead: The Welsh government has set out its legal commitment to achieve net zero by the middle of the century, as well as stating it will push to “get there sooner”.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Arenko partners Gore Street to optimise 10MW battery storage asset
lead: Software company Arenko has signed a new contract with Gore Street Energy Storage Fund to optimise a 10MW asset.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Specialist battery company AMTE announces intention to list on London Stock Exchange
lead: ​Specialist lithium-ion battery manufacturer and developer AMTE Power has announced its intention to seek admission to trading on the Alternative Investment Market (AIM).
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Networks to 'ramp up' investment with £300m on offer to support green developments
lead: The Energy Networks Association, Ofgem and distribution network operators (DNOs) have joined forces to unlock up to £300 million for network upgrades that facilitate green technology.
author: Alice Grundy

title: ABB joins 'critical' Statkraft system stability project
lead: ​Statkraft has unveiled the Lister Drive Greener Grid Park, which is to provide system stability as part of a contract with National Grid ESO.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Interoperability and petrol station EV charger rollout key recommendations of Bright Blue report
lead: A new report from thinktank Bright Blue has detailed the barriers to adoption of battery electric vehicles (BEVs) in the UK, making policy recommendations to address these.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Default price cap jumps £96 as wholesale energy prices rebound
lead: ​The default energy price cap is set to increase by £96 from 1 April 2021, returning to pre-pandemic levels to reflect rising wholesale prices.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BEVs make strong start to 2021 with 54.4% increase in sales
lead: ​Battery electric vehicles (BEVs) are continuing to record strong sales as 2020 is celebrated as delivering the cleanest vehicles in history.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Dynamic Containment remains undersubscribed due to ‘pretty brutal’ requirements
lead: ​Four months into operation, Dynamic Containment is still undersubscribed according to new analysis from EnAppSys.
author: Molly Lempriere
